If you make the value higher, it will decrease the quality level near the focal point.

Automatic Flattening

Since flattening the terrain root might interfere with the updating system, GeoMipTerrain provides an auto-flattening function, which can be really useful if you have too many meshes <too-many-meshes> in your scene. This function calls one of NodePath's flattening functions every time the terrain is regenerated, and each time before the chunks are modified the terrain is restored from a backup node:

python

terrain.setAutoFlatten(GeoMipTerrain.AFMStrong)

cpp

terrain.set_auto_flatten(GeoMipTerrain::AFM_strong);
